stories.text:
I am a CS student and want to learn more about the details of cryptocurrencies, in the hope of contributing to the open-src crypto community in the future.

Due to Google's crappy results, I cannot find anything. So can anyone involved in development of crypto please recommend good books that explain the fundamental details behind cryptocurrencies (PoW, PoS, etc.)?
stories.title: How to learn more about cryptocurrencies?
Craig Wright wins dispute over $50B in Bitcoin
Ask HN: What tool do you use to manage bookmarks?
DeepMind cracks 'knot' conjecture that bedeviled mathematicians for decades
Making Something Social Destroys the Truth of It
MongoDB shares jump as revenue growth accelerates

stories.text: I'm curious if there are paid programs for early-stage startups that you think are worth investing in? Especially for non-technical founders who want to meet technical people. I am aware of YC's Startup School (a great start), but I think paid programs are likely to have more direct mentorship, accountability, and community and those are valuable to me. On Deck now operates like YC - paying for equity, but programs like it? I'm especially interested in programs that foster non-traditional founders or ethical/social impact tech.
stories.title: Ask HN: Are any paid startup programs worth it?
Astra will launch a rocket from Cape Canaveral for the first time in January
Far-right activists using Twitter new rule against anti-extremist researchers
Disney appoints woman as chair for first time in 98-year history
